intro: Hibbertia dealbata, commonly known as the white-flowered sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Hibbertia dealbata has slender stems and small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is an important species for local ecosystems, providing nectar for native pollinators.
